title: Uber lays off 350 employees across Canada and the U.S.
text:
The cuts will affect workers in the Uber Eats, performance marketing, recruiting, Advanced Technologies Group and global rides and platforms departments. Uber did not reply to The Logic’s request for comment on the scope of the layoffs within Canada. (TechCrunch)

Talking point: Uber said this is its third and final wave of layoffs, and it’s the first to affect Canadian employees—the firm cut 435 employees from its product and engineering teams in September, as well as 400 marketing employees in July, but both rounds spared Canadian workers. Uber had said in 2018 it would increase its Toronto staff from 200 to 500 in the coming years. But that was before the firm’s disappointing public debut in May, after which CEO Dara Khosrowshahi announced a major restructuring effort to cut costs. Meanwhile, Uber is investing to expand parts of its business outside its core ride-hailing division, including the launches of a shift-work app and grocery-delivery service.
